title: Reversion Protocols
outcome: Obsolete, rigid fallback BCI protocols activate, reverting the system to Halden’s earliest rules from 2022. Residents are sorted into service tiers based on outdated criteria, paralyzing daily life and sparking irrational restrictions. The Council splits over how to regain control, as Directorate favors hard intervention and Innovators attempt technical workarounds. Civic uncertainty breeds pockets of mistrust and resentment.

events.description: City services are abruptly reorganized using outdated BCI classifications. Many lose benefits while others are granted privileges unexpectedly. Frustration and confusion spark neighborhood protests.
Council meetings turn hostile as Harmonists call for patience, Innovators push for emergency code rewrites, and Directorate demand deployment of security assets to restore order.
Mobility restrictions lock residents in their zones. Attempts to relocate for work or family are denied by default, leading to public demonstrations and online outcry.
Widespread power and service interruptions affect lower-tier residents. Improvised community networks emerge to provide food and basic aid, frustrating authorities but drawing quiet admiration.
